main event: A UFO sighting was reported on 3rd April 1958, northeast of Palm Springs, California. The observation lasted for about 1 hour and involved a solid ball with bright red exhaust that disappeared after the hour.
interesting points: The sighting involved a solid ball with bright red exhaust that just disappeared after 1 hour, leaving no further trace.
The report mentions the observation was made by an ex-airline hostess, adding credibility to the witness.
The observation was made at dawn, and the object was described as being stationary with a single sound.
The conclusion stated that there was insufficient data for evaluation, leaving the nature of the sighting unexplained.
The possibility of a weather balloon release was also considered, hinting at the attempt to find a prosaic explanation.
sighted object: solid ball with bright red exhaust
witnesses: ex-airline hostess, Captain Loser from March Air Force Base Weather Station
